00019 /* alloc flags settings  */
00020 #define OCTEON_DPTR_COALESCED         1
00021 #define OCTEON_DPTR_GATHER            2
00022 #define OCTEON_RPTR_HEADER            4
00023 #define OCTEON_RPTR_SCATTER           8 
00024 #define OCTEON_SOFT_INSTR_ALLOCATED   16
00025 #define OCTEON_SOFT_INSTR_DB_NOW      32
00026 #define OCTEON_DIRECT_GATHER          64
00027 
00028 
00029 
00030 
00031 /** Format of a instruction presented to the driver. This structure has the
00032     values that get posted to Octeon in addition to other fields that are
00033     used by the driver to keep track of the instruction's progress.
00034 */
00035 typedef struct {
00036 
00037     cavium_list_t                    list;
00038 
00039 #define COMPLETION_WORD_INIT    0xffffffffffffffffULL
00040     /** Pointer to the completion status word */
00041     volatile uint64_t               *status_word;
00042 
00043     /** The timestamp (in ticks) till we wait for a response for this
00044         instruction. */
00045     unsigned long                    timeout;
00046 
00047     /**How the response for the instruction should be handled.*/
00048     octeon_request_info_t            req_info;
00049 
00050     /** Input data pointer. It is either pointing directly to input data
00051         or to a gather list which is a list of addresses where data is present. */
00052     void                            *dptr;
00053 
00054     /** Response from Octeon comes at this address. It is either pointing to 
00055         output data buffer directly or to a scatter list which in turn points 
00056         to output data buffers. */
00057     void                            *rptr;
00058 
00059     /** The instruction header. All input commands have this field. */
00060     octeon_instr_ih_t                ih;
00061 
00062     /** Input request header. */
00063     octeon_instr_irh_t               irh;
00064 
00065     /** The PCI instruction to be sent to Octeon. This is stored in the instr
00066         to retrieve the physical address of buffers when instr is freed. */
00067     octeon_instr_64B_t               command;
00068 
00069     /** These headers are used to create a 64-byte instruction  */
00070     uint64_t                         exhdr[4];
00071 
00072     /** Information about the extra headers. */
00073     octeon_exhdr_info_t              exhdr_info;
00074 
00075     /** Flags to indicate memory allocated for this instruction. Used by driver
00076         when freeing the soft instruction.  */
00077     uint32_t                         alloc_flags;
00078 
00079     /** If a gather list was allocated, this ptr points to the buffer used for
00080         the gather list. The gather list has to be 8B aligned, so this value
00081         may be different from dptr.
00082     */
00083     void                            *gather_ptr;
00084 
00085     /** Total data bytes transferred in the gather mode request. */
00086     uint32_t                         gather_bytes;
00087 
00088     /** If a scatter list was allocated, this ptr points to the buffer used for
00089         the scatter list. The scatter list has to be 8B aligned, so this value
00090         may be different from rptr.
00091     */
00092     void                            *scatter_ptr;
00093 
00094     /** Total data bytes to be received in the scatter mode request. */
00095     uint32_t                         scatter_bytes;
00096 
00097 }octeon_soft_instruction_t;
00098 
00099   
00100 #define OCT_SOFT_INSTR_SIZE   (sizeof(octeon_soft_instruction_t))

00103 #define SOFT_INSTR_IRH(pinstr)         ((pinstr)->irh)
00104 #define SOFT_INSTR_OPCODE(pinstr)      ((pinstr)->irh.opcode)
00105 #define SOFT_INSTR_DPTR(pinstr)        ((pinstr)->dptr)
00106 #define SOFT_INSTR_IH(pinstr)          ((pinstr)->ih)
00107 #define SOFT_INSTR_CALLBACK(pinstr)    ((pinstr)->req_info.callback)
00108 #define SOFT_INSTR_CALLBACK_ARG(pinstr) ((pinstr)->req_info.callback_arg)
00109 #define SOFT_INSTR_STATUS(pinstr)      ((pinstr)->req_info.status)
00110 #define SOFT_INSTR_REQUESTID(pinstr)   ((pinstr)->req_info.request_id)
00111 #define SOFT_INSTR_RESP_ORDER(pinstr)  ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.resp_order)
00112 #define SOFT_INSTR_RESP_MODE(pinstr)   ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.resp_mode)
00113 #define SOFT_INSTR_DMA_MODE(pinstr)    ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.dma_mode)
00114 #define SOFT_INSTR_IQ_NO(pinstr)       ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.iq_no)
00115 #define SOFT_INSTR_EXHDR_COUNT(pinstr) ((pinstr)->exhdr_info.exhdr_count)
00116 #define SOFT_INSTR_ALLOCFLAGS(pinstr)  ((pinstr)->alloc_flags)
00117 #define SOFT_INSTR_DLEN(pinstr)        ((pinstr)->ih.dlengsz)
00118 #define SOFT_INSTR_HAS_GATHER(pinstr)  ((pinstr)->ih.gather)
00119 #define SOFT_INSTR_RLEN(pinstr)        ((pinstr)->irh.rlenssz)
00120 #define SOFT_INSTR_HAS_SCATTER(pinstr) ((pinstr)->irh.scatter)
00121 #define SOFT_INSTR_RPTR(pinstr)        ((pinstr)->rptr)
00122 #define SOFT_INSTR_TIMEOUT(pinstr)     ((pinstr)->req_info.timeout)
00123 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_OPCODE(pinstr, val)  ((pinstr)->irh.opcode = (val))
00124 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_IQ_NO(pinstr,  val)  ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.iq_no = (val))
00125 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_TIMEOUT(pinstr, val) ((pinstr)->req_info.timeout=(val))
00126 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_RESP_ORDER(pinstr, vresp_order) \
00127    ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.resp_order = vresp_order)
00128 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_RESP_MODE(pinstr, vresp_mode)   \
00129    ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.resp_mode = (vresp_mode))
00130 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_DMA_MODE(pinstr, vdma_mode)     \
00131    ((pinstr)->req_info.req_mask.dma_mode = (vdma_mode))
00132 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_CALLBACK(pinstr, vcallback)     \
00133    ((pinstr)->req_info.callback = (vcallback))
00134 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_CALLBACK_ARG(pinstr, arg)      \
00135    ((pinstr)->req_info.callback_arg = (arg))
00136 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_STATUS(pinstr, val)            \
00137    ((pinstr)->req_info.status = (val))
00138 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_REQUESTID(pinstr, val)         \
00139    ((pinstr)->req_info.request_id = (val))
00140 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_OCTEONID(pinstr, oct_id)       \
00141    ((pinstr)->req_info.octeon_id = (oct_id))
00142 #define SET_SOFT_INSTR_ALLOCFLAGS(pinstr, val)        \
00143    ((pinstr)->alloc_flags |= (val))
00144 #define INIT_SOFT_INSTR_ALLOCFLAGS(pinstr)            \
00145    ((pinstr)->alloc_flags = 0)

00149 /*----------------------Function prototypes----------------------*/
00150 
00151 /**
00152  *  octeon_process_instruction.
00153  *  NOTE: Starting with release 0.9.6, this routine requires a 3rd parameter
00154  *        which can be NULL in most cases. The 3rd parameter is only set by
00155  *        the driver's octeon_process_request() routine currently.
00156  *  This routine is called by different components of the driver when 
00157  *  an instruction (raw packet) or data packet needs to sent to the
00158  *  Octeon device. All requests from external applications or kernel
00159  *  modules also get routed via this routine.
00160  *
00161  * @param  octeon_dev - pointer to octeon device structure.
00162  * @param  soft_instr - pointer to the soft instruction structure
00163  *                       which has the input commnand to be posted.
00164  * @param  soft_req   - an optional pointer to a soft_request structure.
00165  *                      If present and the instruction is posted successfully,
00166  *                      the status and request id is copied from soft_instr
00167  *                      into the soft_request before returning.
00168  *
00169  * @return: Returns octeon_instr_status_t type value.
00170  *          Set to OCTEON_SOFT_INSTR_FAILED on failure.
00171  *          Else s.status has current status.
00172  */
00173 octeon_instr_status_t 
00174 octeon_process_instruction(octeon_device_t           *octeon_dev, 
00175                            octeon_soft_instruction_t *soft_instr,
00176                            octeon_soft_request_t     *soft_req);
00177
